posts.post_content:
The best thing about the card is that it has no need for subtlety. Massive board sweeping at instant speed can be lethal, and that's where this thing shines. And if you happen to kill an opponent in the process, even better. Well-priced for what it does.  
  
And the flavor text is godly.
posts.html:

And the flavor text is godly.

posts.post_content:
The card is pretty good. An x=![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol) Earthquake is about the same but doesn't hit fliers and is sorcery speed, but you can tune it to only kill the smaller creatures; this is pretty much total destruction all the time. But this card has its uses. I would give it 3.5/5.  
  
  
  
Then I read the flavour text.   
  
5/5.

Posted By: Condor_96 (2/25/2011 11:54:25 PM)

posts.post_content:
@deadeye1387, [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) wouldn't interact with this at all, since this doesn't target. What you want is something that either gives a ton of toughness, like [Slagwurm Armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slagwurm Armor), or prevents damage, like protection (say, from a [Sword of Fire and Ice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Fire and Ice)).  
  
Oh, and it's really simple to tell if something targets (and thus is stopped by shroud): If it says the word "target" on the card, it targets. This doesn't.
posts.html:
@deadeye1387, Whispersilk Cloak wouldn't interact with this at all, since this doesn't target. What you want is something that either gives a ton of toughness, like Slagwurm Armor, or prevents damage, like protection (say, from a Sword of Fire and Ice).

Oh, and it's really simple to tell if something targets (and thus is stopped by shroud): If it says the word "target" on the card, it targets. This doesn't.

posts.post_content:
This is disturbing. I agree with the Jaya Ballard Fan Club.....but I checked every edition. I don't really like any of the artworks.
  
   
We need to get rid of Chandra, bring back Jaya, and reprint this card with Jaya text and a Balefire Dragon :)
  
   
(I actually like Chandra- however, it seems that Red has a sadly very shallow Design space for Walkers, so one way to shake things up and be 'fresh'- one amazingly obvious epic way- is to simply bring back a well loved character and let the story-telling do the work of being cool. Unless, somehow, they invent new mechanical tech to allow a Planeswalker to have Red Elemental Blast as an ability? How would that work? How much loyalty would you have to charge in Blue for Countering on a Planeswalker?)
posts.html:
This is disturbing. I agree with the Jaya Ballard Fan Club.....but I checked every edition. I don't really like any of the artworks.

We need to get rid of Chandra, bring back Jaya, and reprint this card with Jaya text and a Balefire Dragon :)

(I actually like Chandra- however, it seems that Red has a sadly very shallow Design space for Walkers, so one way to shake things up and be 'fresh'- one amazingly obvious epic way- is to simply bring back a well loved character and let the story-telling do the work of being cool. Unless, somehow, they invent new mechanical tech to allow a Planeswalker to have Red Elemental Blast as an ability? How would that work? How much loyalty would you have to charge in Blue for Countering on a Planeswalker?)
